activities: Palantir Technologies Inc. and its wholly-owned U.S. subsidiaries receive personal information, including human resources data, from and about individuals in EU member states and Switzerland for the purposes of workforce management, physical and data security, trade secret and intellectual property protection, company management, business operations, sales operations, customer support and services, and compliance. The personal information received by Palantir from the EU and Switzerland includes both personal data that Palantir processes as a data controller and personal data that Palantir processes as a data processor on behalf of data controllers.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: On-Line, Off-Line, Manually Processed, Human Resources Data
recoursemech: For non-HR data, Palantir will cooperate with JAMS in accordance with the JAMS International Mediation Rules. For HR data only, Palantir will cooperate with EEA data protection authorities (EU DPAs) and the Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC).
